page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: The 3x4km area is predominantly rural but does include one village in the south-eastern area called{Bishop's {Tachbrook.}In the north-eastern area is to be found part of the {A.P.Leamington}works and the still growing{Heathcote Industrial Estate. } Much of the farmland which is gently undulating in character is owned by a few landowners. Within this area is a Sewage Works,a hospital for the elderly and in the north-western corner the grounds of {Warwick Castle}through which runs the {River Avon.} Although the major land-use is crop-growing there are significant areas of grassland, grazing and increasingly,gravel pits. The busy{A41}Warwick-Banbury road runs north to south through the western side of the area.
